sections.heading: 2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
content: The software and database security module equips students with comprehensive knowledge, tools, processes, and methods essential for establishing robust security measures within software and database systems. Emphasizing a foundational approach, it covers fundamental concepts, methodologies, and practical application scenarios. Specifically, students will receive guidance in database management aimed at safeguarding data integrity, minimizing risks such as leakage, tampering, and destruction. Additionally, the module delves into fundamental security management techniques pertinent to databases, encompassing access control, user administration, and rights management. Furthermore, it explores methods to bolster software application security and addresses challenges associated with accessing and manipulating databases from applications. Moreover, the module introduces procedures for formulating security policies, implementing continuous monitoring practices, and maintaining proactive security stances.

2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS 
The software and database security module equips students with comprehensive knowledge, tools, processes, and methods essential for establishing robust security measures within software and database systems. Emphasizing a foundational approach, it covers fundamental concepts, methodologies, and practical application scenarios. Specifically, students will receive guidance in database management aimed at safeguarding data integrity, minimizing risks such as leakage, tampering, and destruction. Additionally, the module delves into fundamental security management techniques pertinent to databases, encompassing access control, user administration, and rights management. Furthermore, it explores methods to bolster software application security and addresses challenges associated with accessing and manipulating databases from applications. Moreover, the module introduces procedures for formulating security policies, implementing continuous monitoring practices, and maintaining proactive security stances.

8. COURSE REQUIREMENT & EXPECTATION
8.1. Requirements for taking final /terminal exams.
Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
8.2. Requirements for attending classes.
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In the case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered failing to complete the course and must re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments. These points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
8.3. Requirements for in-class behavior
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students over 10 minutes late after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
